title: MediTron-70B: Scaling Up Medical Pretraining for Large Language Models
description: As part of the "Engineering Humanitarian Action" initiative, this symposium focused on the future of artificial intelligence in humanitarian efforts. I presented Meditron-70B, a large-scale medical foundation model that demonstrates state-of-the-art performance on medical reasoning tasks and its promising potential for clinical decision-support and humanitarian response.

title: Distilling Counterfactual Data from Large Language Models
location: Allen Institute for AI, Seattle, USA
description: Presented research on using large language models to generate high-quality counterfactual training data for robust NLU systems.

title: Neuro-symbolic Reasoning in Modern AI
location: Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology, Terre Haute, USA
description: Invited lecture on the integration of neural networks with symbolic reasoning for robust AI systems.
